page.title: 08Harry Crofts Quarry
page.content: The man at the{quarry}said it got its name because there was an old coal mine near by and it is not used any more so they gave the name to the quarry.It was opened 8 years ago in {1977.}The stone they quarry is called dolametic{lime stone}from the carboniferous age.The stone is used for building roads and houses and is also used for concrete and draining.At the moment they quarry 200,000 to 300,000 tons of stone every day because they are building the{Worksop {bypass.}The quarry is 300 yards long by 250 yards wide and 30 feet deep.Four to five men work there when they are producing stone but if they are not producing stone only two men work there.
